[description] CinematicNodeContext: A diabolical circle starts to draw itself on the ground. Our of it rises a hologram of Mizora, though not Mizora herself.
Mizora: Playtime's over, pet.
Karlach: Ahh, I love this time of year. The dickheads start popping up wherever you look.
Wyll: What do you want, Mizora?
Mizora: Drop the attitude and perk up your ears - you've got a new mission.
Mizora: Absolute's cult has gone and grabbed one of Zariel's assets. A devil - and a powerful one at that.
Mizora: They're locked up in the cult's fortress, Moonrise Towers. And you're getting 'em out.
Player: Forget it. This 'asset' can rot in the Towers for all I care.
Mizora: I'd start caring - and quick, sunshine.
Mizora: Ahem. Clause Z, Section Thirteen: 'Should promised soul refuse obeyance or neglect duty, the pact-holder shall cast the promised into Avernus as a lemure.'
Mizora: I'll make it simple: Wyll fails or refuses, and he turns to a thick blob of stink-flesh and sinks to Avernus.
Mizora: Now be a good boy and play fetch, pup - or you'll spend an eternity sizzling in the Hells.
: True
Narrator: *Mizora's words may be flippant, but they are tinged with desperation. She cannot afford for Wyll to fail this mission.*
Narrator: *This may be your best chance to negotiate Wyll out of his pact.*
Player: We'll rescue your asset - on one condition.
Mizora: Oh? And what condition is that?
Narrator: *Your mind links with Wyll's, drawn in by his increasing panic.*
Wyll: What are you doing?
Player: You end Wyll's pact and go your separate ways.
Narrator: *A doubtful Wyll catches his breath but says nothing, and your connection fades.*

Player: 'Abi, diabole, et nunquam redi.'
Mizora: Ha. Haha. Hahahahahaha!
Mizora: I've never seen such a fearless display of sheer idiocy. Bravo!

Duke Ulder Ravengard: You acted quickly, decisively, and compassionately. I - nay, all of us - owe you no less than our undying gratitude.
Player: What are you going to do now?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My thoughts are my own now, and my purpose certain. I will wait at your camp - we can speak more there.

Mizora: Let me show you.

Mizora: Where your rightful mistress shoulders the burdens of perpetual war.

: True

Isobel: Speaking of blessings... you'll be needing my protection spell.

Narrator: *The blessing falls uneasily over your tainted body. You can't help but dream: to kill her would destroy all of Last Light. You yearn for it so deeply...*
Shadowheart: Ngh... it hurts...
Isobel: Perfect.
Isobel: It'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.
Isobel: But there are places it won't help - places where the curse is darker. Stronger.
Isobel: The cultists are able to traverse even the deepest shadows, though. I don't know how - the Harpers are trying to figure it out.
Shadowheart: Selnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.
NodeContext: Low-key revulsion
Isobel: Good nose. Like a nasty little terrier.
Player: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.
Isobel: Well! Now you have two. Just in case.
Isobel: I wish you luck. The very best of it.
Player: Wait - Marcus is a True Soul, you know. And not the good kind, like me.

Cordula Eltan: You. The gods-damned disease of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you and the Blade of Frontiers slaughtered his own father, how he craves ultimate power.
Cordula Eltan: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
Cordula Eltan: First I finish you. Then I finish the duke's traitorous son.
Player: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.
: True
Cordula Eltan: Stand down.
Cordula Eltan: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.
Cordula Eltan: What darkness has fallen upon us.
Cordula Eltan: Listen, there's something Wyll should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.
Cordula Eltan: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.
Cordula Eltan: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
Cordula Eltan: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the great champions would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be Wyll.
Player: Why would this training matter?
Cordula Eltan: It is said that only a true champion can awaken the Wyrm. Now that the Grand Duke has fallen, the duty falls to his son.
Cordula Eltan: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: He made Balduran a binding promise to protect the city when its need was greatest.
Cordula Eltan: The city's survived countless threats. But Ravengard knew its walls would fall to the cult.
Cordula Eltan: With him gone and the city near ruin, your call is to unleash the Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
Cordula Eltan: Find it, and follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
Cordula Eltan: Follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
Player: Your faith in us is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

Wyll: It isn't what you think. It never was.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?

Narrator: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
Narrator: *You are Karlach, tearing through demons across a blood-red landscape of fire and volcanic cinder.*
Narrator: *The front lines of the Blood War. With every swing of her axe, Karlach fulfils mistress Zariel's purpose.*
Wyll: Proof, clear as summer sky. It's over, Karlach. It's time you feel the sting of the Blade.
Karlach: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am.
Narrator: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
Narrator: *Wyll shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
Wyll: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!
Karlach: You saw the truth. I may be an effective soldier, but I never wanted to serve Zariel. Legged it away from her the first chance I got.
Wyll: And yet you served.
Player: Stand down. You saw what I saw - Karlach is not a danger.
: True
Narrator: *Wyll catches his breath, and his lips straighten. Sheer dread twists his face.*
Wyll: No. Devils can not be trusted!
Player: You're right. Let's cut her down before she causes any trouble.

Kirgrath: Shit. Brithvar's kicked the tankard. Prick was older than dirt.
Kirgrath: Here's your cut. Half the spoils, like Brithvar said. ([463b0f43-5410-412d-aba3-875cf81c38ca])
Kirgrath: Listen up, Clan Flameshade - we need to cut and run.
NodeContext: Addressed to the room in general
Kirgrath: It's time I scram, before the buggers at Moonrise charge in.
Player: And the slaves? What about them?
Kirgrath: They belong to the clan. They're coming with us.
Karlach: Yeah, right. No chance we're letting those bastards take the gnomes with them. Right?
Player: Set them free, or I will thrash you like I thrashed Nere.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party approaches a mind flayer pod. Inside is the half-devil Mizora, Wyll's patron. She pushes her hands against the transparent cover and smiles. Next to the pod is a console with two buttons on it, the 'unleash' and 'annihilate' buttons on the console in the tutorial.
Mizora: Now enough sniffing around and get me out of this thing.
Narrator: *Your eyes turn to the control panel next to the pod. It has two devices marked with illithid symbols.*
Narrator: *The controls are open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*
Player: Connect your mind to the device on the right and activate it.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the right-side button on the console. Mizora falls out, then gets to her feet.
Mizora: Good work. I'd give you a gold star, but I'm fresh out.

Cordula Eltan: You. The gods-damned disease of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you and the Blade of Frontiers slaughtered his own father, how he craves ultimate power.
Cordula Eltan: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
Cordula Eltan: First I finish you. Then I finish the duke's traitorous son.
Player: Ravengard could still be alive. And we intend to save him.
: True
Cordula Eltan: Stand down.
Cordula Eltan: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.
Cordula Eltan: What darkness has fallen upon us.
Cordula Eltan: Listen, there's something Wyll should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.
Cordula Eltan: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.
Cordula Eltan: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
Cordula Eltan: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the great champions would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be Wyll.
Player: The city has found its protector, thank you very much. Me.
Cordula Eltan: Only a true champion can awaken the wyrm. As the Blade of Frontiers, Wyll has proven his worth. Please, give him this message.
Cordula Eltan: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: He made Balduran a binding promise to protect the city when its need was greatest.
Cordula Eltan: The city's survived countless threats. But Ravengard knew its walls would fall to the cult.
Cordula Eltan: With him gone and the city near ruin, your call is to unleash the Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
Cordula Eltan: Follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
Player: Your faith in us is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party stops as they walk through shadow-cursed town
[description] CinematicNodeContext: A diabolical circle starts to draw itself on the ground. Our of it rises a hologram of Mizora, though not Mizora herself.
Mizora: Playtime's over, pet.
Karlach: Ahh, I love this time of year. The dickheads start popping up wherever you look.
Wyll: What do you want, Mizora?
Mizora: Drop the attitude and perk up your ears - you've got a new mission.
Mizora: Absolute's cult has gone and grabbed one of Zariel's assets. A devil - and a powerful one at that.
Mizora: They're locked up in the cult's fortress, Moonrise Towers. And you're getting 'em out.
Player: Forget it. This 'asset' can rot in the Towers for all I care.
Mizora: I'd start caring - and quick, sunshine.
Mizora: Ahem. Clause Z, Section Thirteen: 'Should promised soul refuse obeyance or neglect duty, the pact-holder shall cast the promised into Avernus as a lemure.'
Mizora: I'll make it simple: Wyll fails or refuses, and he turns to a thick blob of stink-flesh and sinks to Avernus.
Mizora: Now be a good boy and play fetch, pup - or you'll spend an eternity sizzling in the Hells.
: True
Narrator: *Mizora's words may be flippant, but they are tinged with desperation. She cannot afford for Wyll to fail this mission.*
Narrator: *This may be your best chance to negotiate Wyll out of his pact.*
Player: We'll rescue your asset - on one condition.
Mizora: Oh? And what condition is that?
Narrator: *Your mind links with Wyll's, drawn in by his increasing panic.*
Wyll: What are you doing?
Player: Respond to Wyll in your mind. 'Trust me'.
Player: Mizora, we'll rescue this asset if you release Wyll from his pact.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: Is this my fate - to be freed from Gortash's hell only to be trapped in yours?
Wyll: It isn't what you think. It never was.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You turned your back on me, on your city, to chase the she-devil and her power. She stinks up this place even now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It is exactly what I think.
Player: Wyll pulled you from death's grip, and this is how you thank him?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You want my gratitude? Fine - take your fill. But I will not celebrate this infernal resurrection.
Wyll: Father, please - there's something I must show you.
Narrator: *Ravengard's tadpole clenches as your memories - and Wyll's - flow into him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By Tyr's wounds - I'm in your mind...
Narrator: *The Grand Duke sees Mizora and her infernal sisters. He sees the agony in Wyll's face as an impossible choice is set before him.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: No. My son -
Narrator: *The past becomes present, and Wyll's thoughts are laid bare. Ravengard sees Wyll partnering with Mizora to defeat Tiamat's cultists before they could lay siege to Baldur's Gate.*
Narrator: *And he sees everything beyond. The nautiloid journey, the perilous path to Moonrise, the Astral Prism, and the Emperor within.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Wyll.
Wyll: Everything I did, I did for Baldur's Gate. I did for you.
Player: It's the truth, Ravengard. Wyll has always been a faithful defender of Baldur's Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
Wyll: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -
Duke Ulder Ravengard: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.
Player: Go on.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.
Player: A wyrm? Are you saying there's a dragon living under the city?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Since then, the city has faced countless threats, but we always overcame. There was never a need to call on the wyrm - until now.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I once held a copy, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.
Player: Wyll? What do you make of this?

Cordula Eltan: Wyll Ravengard - the stain of Baldur's Gate.
Cordula Eltan: To think your father's blood flows through those damnable veins.
Wyll: Cordula Eltan? By the Nine Hells, what are you on about?
Cordula Eltan: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you slaughtered your own father, how you crave his power.
Cordula Eltan: How you mean to make the city bow to you and you alone.
Wyll: On my honour, father's still alive. And I intend to save him.
: True
Cordula Eltan: Pitiful, how easy the lies come to you.
Wyll: Eltan. I am my father's son. Will you really trust the word of a devil over mine?
Wyll: I swear I did everything I could to save him. I swear it by all I hold dear.
Wyll: A wyrm? Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?
Wyll: It will be done. I will seek the wyrm. Together, we will strike down the Absolute.

Player: Free Wyll, or I let the cult infect you. I bet you'd make a loyal thrall.
: False

Mizora: You wouldn't want Wyll to get sucked into the Hells, would you?

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player walks toward their bedroll/sleeping area.
Narrator: *You are enveloped in myriad sensations, all at once. Flaming desire and icy despair; the strength of iron and the haze of thick swamp mist.*
Mizora: The Nine Hells of Baator. The ultimate torment, some souls would say.
Mizora: Tsk. Those souls lack imagination.
Player: Show me more.
Mizora: With pleasure. As long as you're willing to give in.
Mizora: A banquet lies before you. Why should you not gorge?
Player: What exactly will this entail?
Mizora: I'm going to show you the true wages of your sin.
Narrator: *Pure lust courses through your veins and plucks at your flesh. You don't know what you want, only that you want it.*
Mizora: You feel it, don't you? Primal hunger, irrepressible decadence. Forget the heavens - this is paradise.
Mizora: Let me show you.
Player: I can take it.
Mizora: I know you can, sister. You know just how much the Hells can hurt.
Narrator: *An inferno engulfs you. Your lust blazes hot.*
Mizora: Do you feel it? Avernus. Where Hells' legions march, screaming their rage. Where the Styx collects the blood of the fallen.
Mizora: Where your rightful mistress shoulders the burdens of perpetual war.
Mizora: Reach out. Have a taste.
Player: Give it to me.
Narrator: *The flavour is exquisite as spiced wine, terrible as rotting offal. It does not quench your lust - it only stokes it.*

The player makes a fist, the flame extinguishes, but in doing so a new flood of sensation rushes into their core. Their back and neck arch slightly as they breath deep.
Mizora: Don't worry, pet. I won't leave 'til you're fully satisfied.
Mizora: Dis, the blackened elysium. Minauros, the rotting bog. The molten seas and soil of Phlegethos. Stygia, the frozen ocean.
Mizora: Choose a Hell. Have your fill.
Player: The roiling lava of Phlegethos.
Narrator: *Magma flows around you and into you, and the devil in you is awakened. The heat is unbearable, yet somehow not nearly enough. You crave still more.*

The player extends both arms out toward the flames, palms down. Their eyes close as they connect with Mizora's hellish offerings.

She watches as the pleasure rides out the sensations.
InternalNodeContext: Cannot be aliased due to VFX coloration and narration, anims resued though.
Mizora: To think how you've starved yourself up to this moment. To think how you chose the sweet over the bitter.
Mizora: One last choice, and starve no longer.
Mizora: Malbolge, the desolation. The forgotten ruins of Maladomini. Cania and its mountains of ice. Or Nessus, the seat of infernal power.
Player: Malbolge, craggy and cavernous.
Narrator: *The endlessness of everything and nothing. Black stones, grey cliffs, and the condemned held in cages. A place to lose yourself for a blissful eternity.*

The player player rotates their palms upward, and look up, basking in the arcane sensory experience.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: The player turns and faces Mizora. She is naked, her wings spreads her wings wide.

The flame circle kicks up higher, the player and Mizora float off of the ground.

JLatino: "Mizora looks deeply into the player's eyes and pulls their hands to her breasts." Can we do the Into Wing beat without this, will that save anything?

Mizora: Take me. And know the essence of the Hells.
Player: Pull away.

Narrator: *Calmness greets you as the submersible slows to a halt. Unlike the Iron Throne, you remain intact.*
Narrator: *While the same cannot be said for most of the Gondian hostages, at least one of them survived.*
Narrator: *Duke Ravengard approaches you, looking confused.*
GROUP_Emperors: He's tadpoled, but under my protection now, just like you. His mind is his own again.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I'm... free. In my own mind again, wholly. I will not take it for granted.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You have my gratitude, friend - you acted quickly, decisively. No soul who fell here did so in vain. I will honour their sacrifice.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You acted quickly, decisively, and compassionately. I - nay, all of us - owe you no less than our undying gratitude.
Player: What are you going to do now?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My thoughts are my own now, and my purpose certain. I will wait at your camp - we can speak more there.

Narrator: *Calmness greets you as the submersible slows to a halt. Unlike the Iron Throne, you remain intact.*

[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel gets up
Isobel: What the hells is this?

Player: He was trying to kidnap you. I sensed the tadpole in his head.
Isobel: A tadpole? Maiden's milk - how could that be?
Player: I have no reason to lie. Marcus was a danger to you all.
: True
Isobel: In that case, I owe you a debt of gratitude.
Isobel: You're the True Soul from the gate, right? It's a good thing you were here. I'm Isobel. And we have much to discuss.
Player: I may be a True Soul, but I'm not like Marcus. The parasite doesn't control me.
Isobel: If I didn't believe it before, I certainly do now.
Isobel: Speaking of blessings... you'll be needing my protection spell.
Isobel: Let me guess: Jaheira's sent you to beg a protection spell off her favourite cleric.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: Wyll.

Player: It's time you two made up. We've got a city to save.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: All too right.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My son, you sold your soul to save Baldur's Gate - and I cast you out for it.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You gave yourself to the Hells' eternal fires so I might walk free.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: By the gods, can you ever forgive me?
Wyll: There's nothing to forgive. You wanted to protect the city. I only ever wanted the same.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You are a better man than most, and a better son than I deserve. I'll yet make amends, but -
Duke Ulder Ravengard: - my duty is first and foremost to the city and its people. There's something I must ask of you.
Player: Go on.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Before I was captured, I was on a mission.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Returning from Elturel, I discovered the plans of the Absolutists. I immediately realised the city couldn't defend itself against such an army.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I didn't despair because the city has a secret guardian, a wyrm that sleeps beneath. He can be called upon in times of great need.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: This is such a time. You've been trained in the ways of the great champions and proven to be one of them. The wyrm will answer your call. You must seek him out.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: A bronze dragon, yes. He sleeps beneath us even now, awaiting a hero to rouse him.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: He promised Balduran he'd protect the city if ever its existence was threatened. But just the once.

Duke Ulder Ravengard: The Absolute is the greatest threat Baldur's Gate ever faced. The wyrm must be awakened - and the task falls to you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. An ancient epic, ill-remembered, dismissed as a mere tale.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I once held a copy, but it was stolen. Find it, let it set the path before you.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: Let it set the path before you.

GROUP_Emperors: He's tadpoled, but under my protection now, just like you. His mind is his own again.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: I'm... free. In my own mind again, wholly. I will not take it for granted.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You have my gratitude, friend - you acted quickly, decisively. No soul who fell here did so in vain. I will honour their sacrifice.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You acted quickly, decisively, and compassionately. I - nay, all of us - owe you no less than our undying gratitude.
Player: How did you end up in the Iron Throne?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It's where Gortash stores his playthings. His keepsakes. But I am his trinket no longer.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My thoughts are my own now, and my purpose certain. I will wait at your camp - we can speak more there.

Shadowheart: You're here. Just like it told me you'd be, gith.
Narrator: *Your mind rushes into hers - a storm of desperation, confusion and a will other than her own.*

Shadowheart: It took me so long to find you.
Player: What's wrong? You seem different than before.
Shadowheart: No questions! I can't... concentrate with all these voices! Just listen.
Shadowheart: The whispering won't let me sleep. It keeps pushing me - to you.
Shadowheart: Even when I'm awake, I dream. There's blood, there's so much blood.
Shadowheart: I can't sleep. The whispering won't let me. It keeps pushing me - to you.
NodeContext: On, " to you" SH's hand drifts toward a knife tucked into her belt at the small her back
Lae'zel: The ravings of a lunatic. Strike her down.
: True
Narrator: *There is a knife hidden in her belt. Her fingers twitch towards the hilt, ready to draw the blade.*
Player: Keep your hands away from that blade.
Shadowheart: I keep thinking about the knife going deep. It's the only thing they want me to see.
Shadowheart: And I think they'll stop once I deal with you.
Player: Don't do anything rash. There has to be an explanation for this.
Shadowheart: I don't want explanations. I want sleep.
Shadowheart: The whispering's already quieter here. Once you're dead, it'll be gone entirely.
Player: Threaten me again, and it'll be the last thing you do.
: True
Shadowheart: What else do I do? My head is splitting open. I can't leave. I can't!
Player: You can stay here. I'll watch over you.

Umi: I can't do it. I'm not like you.

NodeContext: Wyll holding is holding a sword with his RIGHT hand.
Wyll: You just have to buy enough time to run. Come on. I believe in you. You can do this.
Player: Hey there. Can I have a word?
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Wyll turns to you, smiling.
Wyll: Well met. The Blade of Frontiers at your -
Narrator: *The man's smile bends downward, and his thoughts become yours.*

Narrator: *It's Karlach - the woman you met in the wilds.*
Wyll: Hells' great fires - you were on the ship.
Player: Yes - and we both carry parasites.
Wyll: Mm - doomed to shed our skin and become illithid, or so the stories go.
Wyll: But we haven't sprouted any tentacles - not yet, anyway. Could just be good luck. I'm not so...
Narrator: *Your minds collide once more. Wyll chases the fiend, ignited with rancour. She is an infernal wardevil, a threat to the living - evil incarnate.*
Wyll: Shit - you saw her: advocatus diaboli.
: False
Narrator: *Advocatus diaboli. A devil's advocate - a champion in the Blood War between diabolical forces and demons.*
Player: Also known as Karlach. She's in the wilds, some ways from here.
Wyll: You met her? Then you were subject to her lies.
Wyll: Karlach is an archdevil's soldier I swore on my good eye to kill.
Wyll: I tracked her through the Hells to the mind flayer ship. But the damned illithids infected me before I could end her.
Wyll: She's out there now, preying on the innocent. I don't kill her, she'll leave behind nothing but a trail of corpses.
Player: Let's join forces. I'll help you cast this devil back into the Hells.

Fist Marcus: Hello, Isobel.

Isobel: Marcus - is that you? What's happened to you?
Fist Marcus: I've been blessed. You can be too. Come with me and you can hear it all from Ketheric himself.
Player: What are you?
Fist Marcus: True Soul. My instructions are clear: take the girl to Ketheric. Alive.
Player: Probe his thoughts for more information.
: True
Narrator: *A haunting face swims into your mind's eye, its instructions vivid in your mind: nothing is more important than bringing the girl - alive.*
Isobel: What's going on? If you have something to say, say it.
Player: Marcus is trying to kidnap you, Isobel. We're going to need to fight our way out of this one.

Mizora: Now enough sniffing around and get me out of this thing.

: True
Mizora: Incredible - you actually think you hold the winning hand.
Mizora: Fine, I'll play your game. But I amend the pact once I'm freed - not before.

: True

Mizora steps out of the pod.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: [opening, face-to-face]

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.

Wyll and Karlach stand facing one another, fists clenched.
Wyll: One horn. The stink of Avernus. Advocatus diaboli.
Karlach: Well I'll be godsdamned - the Blade of Frontiers. Thought I'd shaken you for good. That'll teach me to underestimate you.
Wyll: Karlach. The archdevil Zariel's gladiator, come to burn the Sword Coast to ash.
Player: You've got it all wrong, Wyll. Karlach's not about to hurt anyone.
Karlach: Well - not counting the fuckers that need a good hurting.
Wyll: Shut it, devil - I know your kind. A heart darker than a shadow's nightmares. You'd cut a child's throat just to taste the blood.
Karlach: A devil? I didn't take the Blade for a fool. I'm - ngh!
Narrator: *A great fire roars through you - the fire of the First Hell.*
Narrator: *You are Karlach, tearing through demons across a blood-red landscape of fire and volcanic cinder.*
Narrator: *The front lines of the Blood War. With every swing of her axe, Karlach fulfils mistress Zariel's purpose.*
Wyll: Proof, clear as summer sky. It's over, Karlach. It's time you feel the sting of the Blade.
Karlach: I've tried to tell you - I'm not what you think I am.
Narrator: *Another vision. Karlach's blade raised, slicing through devils - Zariel's servants - as her eyes dart around, seeking escape.*
Narrator: *Wyll shudders with Karlach's desperation. She is a victim of the Blood War, not an agent of it.*
Wyll: By Balduran's helm, I - no. I will not be tricked!
Karlach: You saw the truth. I may be an effective soldier, but I never wanted to serve Zariel. Legged it away from her the first chance I got.
Wyll: And yet you served.
Player: Be practical. She's infected, same as us. We need allies, not enemies.
: False
Wyll: No. Devils can not be trusted!
Player: You're right. Let's cut her down before she causes any trouble.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party approaches a mind flayer pod. Inside is the half-devil Mizora, Wyll's patron. She pushes her hands against the transparent cover and smiles. Next to the pod is a console with two buttons on it, the 'unleash' and 'annihilate' buttons on the console in the tutorial.
Mizora: Now enough sniffing around and get me out of this thing.
Narrator: *Mizora's life rests in your hands. Perhaps you could end Wyll's pact, here and now.*
Player: Free Wyll, or I let the cult infect you. I bet you'd make a loyal thrall.
: False

Mizora: You wouldn't want Wyll to get sucked into the Hells, would you?
Mizora: Now open the pod.
Narrator: *Your eyes turn to the control panel next to the pod. It has two devices marked with illithid symbols.*
Narrator: *The controls are open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*
Player: SMASH THE POD.
: True
[description] CinematicNodeContext: [reuse]  The player's fist slams against the pod and it cracks open.

Mizora steps out of the pod.

Mizora steps out of the pod.
Mizora: Good work. I'd give you a gold star, but I'm fresh out.

Isobel: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel kneeling at corpse
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel gets up
Isobel: What the hells is this?
Narrator: *Your tingling Urge knows her face - this is the cleric Sceleritas sent you to kill.*
Player: He was trying to kidnap you. I sensed the tadpole in his head.
Isobel: A tadpole? Maiden's milk - how could that be?
Player: I have no reason to lie. Marcus was a danger to you all.
: True
Isobel: In that case, I owe you a debt of gratitude.
Isobel: You're the True Soul from the gate, right? It's a good thing you were here. I'm Isobel. And we have much to discuss.
Player: I may be a True Soul, but I'm not like Marcus. The parasite doesn't control me.
Isobel: If I didn't believe it before, I certainly do now.
Isobel: Speaking of blessings... you'll be needing my protection spell.
Isobel: Let me guess: Jaheira's sent you to beg a protection spell off her favourite cleric.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene. (lighting tests in progree for clouds revealing the moon)

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|
Narrator: *The blessing falls uneasily over your tainted body. You can't help but dream: to kill her would destroy all of Last Light. You yearn for it so deeply...*
Shadowheart: Ngh... it hurts...
Isobel: Perfect.
Isobel: It'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.
Isobel: But there are places it won't help - places where the curse is darker. Stronger.
Isobel: The cultists are able to traverse even the deepest shadows, though. I don't know how - the Harpers are trying to figure it out.
Shadowheart: Selnite magic. Dark Lady forgive me.
NodeContext: Low-key revulsion
Isobel: Good nose. Like a nasty little terrier.
Player: I already have a Moonlantern. I can safely travel the shadows.
Isobel: Well! Now you have two. Just in case.
Isobel: I wish you luck. The very best of it.
Player: Hold on - Marcus is a True Soul. He's here to kidnap you.

Narrator: *Calmness greets you as the submersible slows to a halt. Unlike the Iron Throne, you remain intact.*
Narrator: *So, it seems, will the families of all the hostages rescued from the Throne.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You acted quickly, decisively, and compassionately. I - nay, all of us - owe you no less than our undying gratitude.
Player: The Absolute's voice has gone silent. It must be a relief.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: The... the Absolute. Its voice was clear as crystal, beautiful as a nymph's smile. It showed me the darkest lies and convinced me of their truth.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: To be free is like knowing the sun's warmth on my face for the first time.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My thoughts are my own now, and my purpose certain. I will wait at your camp - we can speak more there.

Fist Marcus: Ah. True Soul. How glad I am to see you again.
InternalNodeContext: Player revealed Marcus at the checkpoint.
Isobel: Not a step closer, Marcus. I'm warning you.
Fist Marcus: I don't know what your game is, but you can still redeem yourself if you follow my lead.

NodeContext: Anger in his voice.
Fist Marcus: Remember: Ketheric wants her alive.
Fist Marcus: Let's do this. Remember: Ketheric wants her alive.
Isobel: What the hells is going on?
NodeContext: SArcasm and fury in her voice as she enters battle position.
Player: Probe his thoughts for more information.
: True
Narrator: *A haunting face swims into your mind's eye, its instructions vivid in your mind: nothing is more important than bringing the girl - alive.*
Isobel: What's going on? If you have something to say, say it.
Player: Marcus is trying to kidnap you, Isobel. We're going to need to fight our way out of this one.

Cordula Eltan: You. The gods-damned disease of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you and the Blade of Frontiers slaughtered his own father, how he craves ultimate power.
Cordula Eltan: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
Cordula Eltan: First I finish you. Then I finish the duke's traitorous son.
Player: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
Cordula Eltan: Stand down.
Cordula Eltan: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.
Cordula Eltan: What darkness has fallen upon us.
Cordula Eltan: Listen, there's something Wyll should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.
Cordula Eltan: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.
Cordula Eltan: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
Cordula Eltan: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the great champions would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be Wyll.
Player: Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?
Cordula Eltan: A bronze dragon, to be precise, sleeping beneath us.
Cordula Eltan: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: He made Balduran a binding promise to protect the city when its need was greatest.
Cordula Eltan: The city's survived countless threats. But Ravengard knew its walls would fall to the cult.
Cordula Eltan: With him gone and the city near ruin, your call is to unleash the Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: There is a tome - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
Cordula Eltan: Find it, and follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
Cordula Eltan: Follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
Player: Your faith in us is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party stops as they walk through shadow-cursed town
[description] CinematicNodeContext: A diabolical circle starts to draw itself on the ground. Our of it rises a hologram of Mizora, though not Mizora herself.
Mizora: Playtime's over, pet.
Karlach: Ahh, I love this time of year. The dickheads start popping up wherever you look.
Wyll: What do you want, Mizora?
Mizora: Drop the attitude and perk up your ears - you've got a new mission.
Mizora: Absolute's cult has gone and grabbed one of Zariel's assets. A devil - and a powerful one at that.
Mizora: They're locked up in the cult's fortress, Moonrise Towers. And you're getting 'em out.
Player: Forget it. This 'asset' can rot in the Towers for all I care.
Mizora: I'd start caring - and quick, sunshine.
Mizora: Ahem. Clause Z, Section Thirteen: 'Should promised soul refuse obeyance or neglect duty, the pact-holder shall cast the promised into Avernus as a lemure.'
Mizora: I'll make it simple: Wyll fails or refuses, and he turns to a thick blob of stink-flesh and sinks to Avernus.
Mizora: Now be a good boy and play fetch, pup - or you'll spend an eternity sizzling in the Hells.
: True
Narrator: *Mizora's words may be flippant, but they are tinged with desperation. She cannot afford for Wyll to fail this mission.*
Narrator: *This may be your best chance to negotiate Wyll out of his pact.*
Player: We'll rescue your asset - on one condition.
Mizora: Oh? And what condition is that?
Narrator: *Your mind links with Wyll's, drawn in by his increasing panic.*
Wyll: What are you doing?
Player: Respond to Wyll in your mind. 'Trust me'.
Player: Mizora, we'll rescue this asset if you release Wyll from his pact.
Mizora: Interesting. Now why should I go letting my favourite pet off his leash?
Player: We could always let the cult infect the asset. I bet they'd make a loyal thrall.
: True
Mizora: Incredible - you actually think you hold the winning hand.
Mizora: Fine, I'll play your game. But I amend the pact once the mission's done - not before.

Narrator: *As the symbol glows, power courses through you. Authority.*
Player: Good idea. They will make a fine offering.
Sergeant Thrinn: Yes. They will serve the Absolute's Chosen.
Gale: Brittle are the foundations upon which the houses of tyrants are built. It seems I judged you to be less brittle than you really are.
Sergeant Thrinn: It's time I met the General in the flesh.
Player: I am freeing these gnomes. Just try and stop me.

Cordula Eltan: You. The gods-damned disease of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: Lady Mizora told me everything. How you and the Blade of Frontiers slaughtered his own father, how he craves ultimate power.
Cordula Eltan: How he means to make the city bow to him and him alone.
Cordula Eltan: First I finish you. Then I finish the duke's traitorous son.
Player: Zariel's stunt destroyed countless lives. Mizora is her minion - you can't trust her.
Cordula Eltan: Stand down.
Cordula Eltan: I believe you, the Battle Lord help me.
Cordula Eltan: What darkness has fallen upon us.
Cordula Eltan: Listen, there's something Wyll should know. On his way from Elturel, Ravengard sent a messenger with word of the cult.
Cordula Eltan: He knew about the Absolute. I thought little of it at first - but he realised the danger before anyone else did.
Cordula Eltan: He understood that if the cult were successful in raising an army, Baldur's Gate would be doomed.
Cordula Eltan: And he knew that to protect the city, one trained in the ways of the great champions would have to rouse the wyrm living beneath. If I'm not mistaken, that would be Wyll.
Player: Do you mean there's a dragon living under the city?
Cordula Eltan: A bronze dragon, to be precise, sleeping beneath us.
Cordula Eltan: The wyrm goes by many names. Ansur. The Waiting Storm. The Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: He made Balduran a binding promise to protect the city when its need was greatest.
Cordula Eltan: The city's survived countless threats. But Ravengard knew its walls would fall to the cult.
Cordula Eltan: With him gone and the city near ruin, your call is to unleash the Heart of the Gate.
Cordula Eltan: Take this - 'The Legend of Ansur'. The bards call it a tall tale. But every last word is true.
Cordula Eltan: Follow its path to the wyrm. Or do not, and let the Coast be drowned in blood.
Player: Your faith in us is well-founded. We will seek the wyrm and ask for his help.

Isobel: CinematicNodeContext: Isobel kneeling at corpse
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Isobel gets up
Isobel: What the hells is this?
Narrator: *Your tingling Urge knows her face - this is the cleric Sceleritas sent you to kill.*
Player: He was trying to kidnap you. I sensed the tadpole in his head.
Isobel: A tadpole? Maiden's milk - how could that be?
Player: I have no reason to lie. Marcus was a danger to you all.
: True
Isobel: In that case, I owe you a debt of gratitude.
Isobel: You're the True Soul from the gate, right? It's a good thing you were here. I'm Isobel. And we have much to discuss.
Player: I may be a True Soul, but I'm not like Marcus. The parasite doesn't control me.
Isobel: If I didn't believe it before, I certainly do now.
Isobel: Speaking of blessings... you'll be needing my protection spell.
Isobel: Let me guess: Jaheira's sent you to beg a protection spell off her favourite cleric.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: |Casts 'Protection from Good and Evil', but modified with Selunite (moon) magic to protect against the Shadowcurse specifically. Isobel can use the planned animations for this spell cinematically, or something bespoke as best fits the scene. (lighting tests in progree for clouds revealing the moon)

We see every present party member  take on a moon-like effect as a result of being targeted with the spell, which then fades as though absorbed by each of them. This gives them a special in-game status to protect them from the curse|

Narrator: *The blessing falls uneasily over your tainted body. You can't help but dream: to kill her would destroy all of Last Light. You yearn for it so deeply...*
Shadowheart: Ngh... it hurts...
Isobel: Perfect.
Isobel: It'll make you immune to the lesser effects of the shadow curse, which will get you closer to the Towers.
Isobel: But there are places it won't help - places where the curse is darker. Stronger.
Isobel: The cultists are able to traverse even the deepest shadows, though. I don't know how - the Harpers are trying to figure it out.
Shadowheart: A gaudy display. Let's just hope it actually protects us.
NodeContext: Distaste (while keeping her cards to her chest re: her shar worship)
Isobel: Only a fool would doubt it.
Player: Very nice of you, but I've been to Moonrise Towers already.
Isobel: You... have. Forgive me for gilding the lily. I suppose if Jaheira hasn't gone tearing into the night, there's work to be done there yet.
Isobel: I wish you luck. The very best of it.
Player: Hold on - Marcus is a True Soul. He's here to kidnap you.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party approaches a mind flayer pod. Inside is the half-devil Mizora, Wyll's patron. She pushes her hands against the transparent cover and smiles. Next to the pod is a console with two buttons on it, the 'unleash' and 'annihilate' buttons on the console in the tutorial.
Mizora: Now enough sniffing around and get me out of this thing.
Narrator: *Mizora's life rests in your hands. Perhaps you could end Wyll's pact, here and now.*
Player: 'Abi, diabole, et nunquam redi.'
Mizora: Ha. Haha. Hahahahahaha!
Mizora: I'll be damned. You want to free the pup from his pact.
Mizora: And you thought that idiotic display would do it? Bravo!
Mizora: Fine, I'll play your game. But I amend the pact once I'm freed - not before.
Mizora: Clause F, Section Nine: 'Soul-binder shall bestow reward or favour only upon soul-bearer's fulfilment of related obligation.'
Narrator: *You've heard of this provision - better known as the 'You First' clause.*
Mizora: Now open the pod.
Narrator: *Your eyes turn to the control panel next to the pod. It has two devices marked with illithid symbols.*
Narrator: *The controls are open to your tadpole's command - to your authority.*
Player: Connect your mind to the device on the right and activate it.
[description] CinematicNodeContext: Player presses the right-side button on the console. Mizora falls out, then gets to her feet.
Mizora: Good work. I'd give you a gold star, but I'm fresh out.

[description] CinematicNodeContext: The party stops as they walk through shadow-cursed town
[description] CinematicNodeContext: A diabolical circle starts to draw itself on the ground. Our of it rises a hologram of Mizora, though not Mizora herself.
Mizora: Playtime's over, pet.
Karlach: Ahh, I love this time of year. The dickheads start popping up wherever you look.
Wyll: What do you want, Mizora?
Mizora: Drop the attitude and perk up your ears - you've got a new mission.
Mizora: Absolute's cult has gone and grabbed one of Zariel's assets. A devil - and a powerful one at that.
Mizora: They're locked up in the cult's fortress, Moonrise Towers. And you're getting 'em out.
Player: And this is our problem how, exactly?
Mizora: Ahem. Clause Z, Section Thirteen: 'Should promised soul refuse obeyance or neglect duty, the pact-holder shall cast the promised into Avernus as a lemure.'
Mizora: I'll make it simple: Wyll fails or refuses, and he turns to a thick blob of stink-flesh and sinks to Avernus.
Mizora: Now be a good boy and play fetch, pup - or you'll spend an eternity sizzling in the Hells.
: True
Narrator: *Mizora's words may be flippant, but they are tinged with desperation. She cannot afford for Wyll to fail this mission.*
Narrator: *This may be your best chance to negotiate Wyll out of his pact.*
Player: We'll rescue your asset - on one condition.
Mizora: Oh? And what condition is that?
Narrator: *Your mind links with Wyll's, drawn in by his increasing panic.*
Wyll: What are you doing?
Player: You end Wyll's pact and go your separate ways.
Narrator: *A doubtful Wyll catches his breath but says nothing, and your connection fades.*
Mizora: Interesting. Now why should I go letting my favourite pet off his leash?
Player: Say you know a pact-breaking charm and chant a series of pseudo-Infernal phrases.
: True
Mizora: I've never seen such a fearless display of sheer idiocy. Bravo!
Mizora: Fine, I'll play your game. But I amend the pact once the mission's done - not before.

Narrator: *Calmness greets you as the submersible slows to a halt. Unlike the Iron Throne, you remain intact.*
Narrator: *So, it seems, will the families of all the hostages rescued from the Throne.*
Duke Ulder Ravengard: You acted quickly, decisively, and compassionately. I - nay, all of us - owe you no less than our undying gratitude.
Player: How did you end up in the Iron Throne?
Duke Ulder Ravengard: It's where Gortash stores his playthings. His keepsakes. But I am his trinket no longer.
Duke Ulder Ravengard: My thoughts are my own now, and my purpose certain. I will wait at your camp - we can speak more there.
